See also: Appendix:Variations of "mai"

English[edit]

Proper noun[edit]

Mai

  1. A female given name, a rare spelling variant of Mae/May, or borrowed from Scandinavia, with the same ultimate origin.
  2. A surname​ of Chinese or German origin.

Anagrams[edit]

  • AIM, AMI, I am, I'm a, I'm a', I'm'a, I'ma, IAM, Ima, Ima', MIA, Mia, aim, i'm'a, i'ma, ima, mia

Danish[edit]

Proper noun[edit]

Mai

  1. A female given name, variant of Maj.

Estonian[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Short form of Maia, from Maarja / Maria; also associated with the month mai (“May”).

Proper noun[edit]

Mai

  1. A female given name.

Ewe[edit]

Proper noun[edit]

Mai

  1. May (month)

Related terms[edit]

  • Damɛ

Friulian[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Latin māius.

Noun[edit]

Mai

  1. May

German[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /maɪ/
  • audio
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɪ̯

Noun[edit]

Mai m (genitive Mais or Mai, plural Maie)

  1. May (month)

Declension[edit]

Derived terms[edit]

  • Maibaum

Japanese[edit]

Romanization[edit]

Mai

  1. Rōmaji transcription of まい

Norwegian[edit]

Proper noun[edit]

Mai

  1. A female given name, short for Maja, Maria, or from the month.

Vietnamese[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Sino-Vietnamese word from 梅.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Hà Nội) IPA(key): [maːj˧˧]
  • (Huế) IPA(key): [maːj˧˧]
  • (Hồ Chí Minh City) IPA(key): [maːj˧˧]
  • Homophone: mai

Proper noun[edit]

Mai

  1. A surname​.
  2. A female given name originating from Chinese

Welsh[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from Latin Māius.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /mai̯/
  • Audio
    		(file)

Proper noun[edit]

Mai m

  1. May

Synonyms[edit]

  • cyntefin
